duties_responsibilities.duty: Oversee the management and reporting of hospital performance and statistics.
Lead a high performing management team; attract, recruit, develop and retain team members.
Implement and lead a continuous quality improvement process.
Create and identify new ideas and opportunities for the hospital that will promote staff and client experiences as well as improve the quality of life for animals in our care.
Drive collaboration to ensure consistent services and guest experience is offered across the practice in all departments.
Plan, manage, organize, implement and evaluate programs, services, activities, and procedures on an ongoing basis.
Provide leadership in developing standards of care, operation, and financial plans, as well as implementing policies and procedures.
Uphold core values and standards, and promote a cooperative working environment among staff members.
Communicate the practice’s values and mission to the team, and motivate staff to help build and maintain morale.
Promote continuous quality improvement (CQI) to ensure the practice’s success and achieve the vision.
Analyze various sources of data to establish priorities and initiate operational programs.
Show empathy toward clients and treat animals with respect and compassion.
Read and analyze a P&L statement, and demonstrate competence in budgeting and financial reporting.
Maintain inventory and an inventory control system, and manage the hospital software, and implement safety and security procedures.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in business or related field (MBA or MPH preferred)
Certified Veterinary Practice Manager designation or equivalent work experience preferred
